title: docs(README.md): fix spelling
body:
- accomodate => accommodate
- determing => determining
- read => reads
author: vladdoster

comments.body: Congratulations on reaching the front-page of HN!

satisfaction_conditions: Acknowledgment of the spelling corrections identified in the README.md file
Recognition of the contribution, however small

title: Custom termial program selection
body:
Hi! It's an great project! And I tried on my windows PC. It is working as I expected!
The only thing that I was using gitbash as my default terminal. So if there has an option to change default terminal in editor setting that could be the last part I am looking forward to.
Thanks!
By the way. I tried to change "cmd" to "bash" in **PtyProxyWin**, But it is not working!
author: hakuhan

comments.body:
You can put the git bash command in your initial command list in the editor settings for gdterm

It will then execute that command immediately when the terminal starts
Thanks! I use `bash --login -i` as start command line to achieve it.

satisfaction_conditions: A way to use Git Bash as the default terminal in the editor
A configuration method that works within the existing editor settings
A solution that works on Windows

title: How does TOS caching and GC roots interact?
body:
Hi PrimJS developers. First of all, great work on the runtime!

GC docs say that one of the roots is the `Interpreter Execution Stack`. However, the interpreter docs also say primjs does TOS caching. Once values are TOS cached into register x0/x1, don't they become invisible to the GC? In that case, how are the objects kept alive?

This is just a curious question, as I work on CPython, and we're planning to do TOS caching too.
author: Fidget-Spinner

comments.body:
Before the interpreter jumps to runtime, x0 and x1 are pushed onto the stack.
Then the gc mark stage will scan the stack

satisfaction_conditions: An explanation of how TOS cached values remain visible to the garbage collector
A clear description of the mechanism that prevents memory leaks when using TOS caching
Information that is transferable to other runtime implementations

title: HeliBoard integration
body: Just a quick question, how do I get HeliBoard to call Whisper instead of the Google voice assistant when pressing the mic button in the toolbar?
author: C-O-D

comments.body: Just switch off Google voice input method in Android settings

satisfaction_conditions: A simple method to configure HeliBoard to use Whisper instead of Google voice assistant
Instructions that don't require technical expertise or complex setup

title: [SOLVED/CLOSED] High scores not working
body:
Specs
Moto G9 Power
LineageOS 22.1
Android 15

Info:
I take 2 or 3 seconds to complete the test but my highscore shows 82, 12 or 7 seconds. If needed i can upload a video playing with w/ a timer on screen.
author: artur15lima

comments.body: Hi, the timer starts the moment the numbers become visible on the screen, not after you press 1. Please confirm that this is how you're timing yourself too.
Ok, now i understand it. Tysm.

satisfaction_conditions: Clarification about when the timer starts in the game
Explanation for the discrepancy between perceived completion time and recorded high scores
